item.title: Recurrent Neural Network and Maximal Figure of Merit for Acoustic Event Detection
item.description: In this report, we describe the systems submitted to the DCASE 2017 challenge. In particular, we explored convolutional recurrent neural network (CRNN) for acoustic scene classification (Task 1). For the weakly supervised sound event detection (Task 4), we utilized CRNN by embedding maximal figure-of-merit (CRNNMFoM) into the binary cross-entropy objective function. On the development data set, the CRNN model achieves an average 14.7% relative accuracy improvement on the classification Task 1, the CRNN-MFoM improves F1-score from 10.
